Ingredients.1: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces

Ingredients.2: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.11: 1 (16 ounce) package pad Thai rice noodles

Directions.1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.

Directions.2: Season chicken with salt and black pepper; set aside.

Directions.3: Whisk sugar, cayenne pepper, white wine vinegar, fish sauce, and peanut butter together in a bowl.

Directions.4: Coat the inside of a large skillet or wok with olive oil and place over high heat.

Directions.5: Cook and stir chicken in the hot oil just until the meat is white outside but still pink inside, about 3 minutes.

Directions.6: Remove chicken and set aside in a bowl.

Directions.7: Lower the heat under the skillet to medium-low. Cook and stir garlic in the skillet until it becomes translucent, 1 to 2 minutes.

Directions.8: Cook and stir eggs into garlic until loosely cooked, 2 to 3 minutes.

Directions.9: Pour peanut sauce into the garlic and eggs, and stir to combine. Bring sauce to a simmer.

Directions.10: Stir rice noodles into the boiling water. Cook until noodles are still slightly tough, about 5 minutes.

Directions.12: Return chicken to the skillet with eggs and sauce. Simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, stirring frequently, 5 to 8 more minutes.

Directions.13: Stir bean sprouts, rice noodles. and beef broth into the skillet. Bring to a simmer, and cook until noodles are tender and most of the broth has been absorbed, about 10 minutes.

Directions.14: Sprinkle with green onions to serve..
